# Memento

> Personal digital memory archive for macOS. Captures screenshots every 10 minutes, logs keystrokes with app context, runs OCR for searchability. All data stays local. Optional R2 cloud backup.

## Quick Facts

- **RAM**: ~18MB
- **Storage**: ~6MB/day, ~180MB/month, ~2GB/year
- **Screenshots**: WebP format, half-resolution, ~100KB each
- **Platform**: macOS 12+
- **Privacy**: 100% local, no data leaves your machine unless you enable R2 backup

## Install

```bash
curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Mahir-Isikli/memento/master/scripts/install-memento.sh | bash
```

After install, grant Accessibility and Screen Recording permissions in System Settings, then restart.

## Features

- **Screenshots**: Captured every 10 minutes in optimized WebP format
- **Keystrokes**: Logged with application name and window title context
- **OCR**: Apple Vision framework extracts text from screenshots for search
- **Search**: Query your digital history with `memento search "term"`
- **Backup**: Optional encrypted backup to Cloudflare R2 (10GB free tier = 4+ years)

## Commands

```bash
memento start          # Start daemon (runs in background)
memento stop           # Stop daemon
memento status         # Check if running
memento search "term"  # Search screenshots and keystrokes
memento backup         # Manual backup to R2 (if configured)
```

- [GitHub Repository](https://github.com/Mahir-Isikli/memento)
- [Installation Script](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Mahir-Isikli/memento/master/scripts/install-memento.sh)
